title: Fatherâ€™s Day: The Galaxy S25 Ultra Is at Its Lowest Price Ever
description: There's no better time to buy the Samsung's top-of-the-line device than right now.
author: Ayomide Sadiq
excerpt: There's no better time to buy the Samsung's top-of-the-line device than right now.
text: Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more. I give Samsung a hard time for its reluctance to adopt trends that would only benefit the customers (silicon-carbon batteries, faster charging, updated cameras on non-Ultra models). However, if I don't compare and focus solely on each Samsung phone, it is hard to say that they aren't excellent. In fact, the S series is consistently good every year. This year, we have the Galaxy S25 series, which doesn't bring that many changes to the spec sheet, but focuses mostly on optimizing the Galaxy AI experience that was introduced last year. The software is great, especially with One UI 7; the hardware is amazing, as usual; and that high price is at its lowest ever, in time for a Father's Day gift. The Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra Is Available at $300 off on Amazon Right Now Image: Samsung I don't know if the Galaxy S25 Ultra is unarguably the flagship of the year, but to say that it isn't even in the running would be dishonest. The device brings the usual excellent Samsung formula, with a magnificent display, an overclocked Snapdragon 8 Elite, a great camera setup, and good software. For anyone who wants a flagship smartphone without doing too much research, you can never go wrong with the S25 Ultra. Of course, being the most capable on paper than any of Samsung's other smartphones, it is no surprise that this one costs a lot of money. In fact, the S25 Ultra retails at $1,299, making it the second-most expensive device in the South Korean OEM's worldwide lineup, second only to the Galaxy Z Fold 6. Galaxy S25 Ultra (256GB)Galaxy S25 Ultra (512GB)Launch Price$1,299$1,419Discounted Pricing $999$1,119Percentage Discount23%21%Dollar Discount$300$300 The good thing is, you can ignore that usually heavy pricing, at least for a limited amount of time. The Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is currently enjoying a hefty discount on Amazon US, knocking off $300, equivalent to 23% of its price, to bring it down to $999. The 512GB model also has a $300 discount at the moment. Image: Samsung Just so you know, the S25 Ultra has never been in the three-digit price range on Amazon, so this is a record price, and it is definitely worth getting for yourself or as a gift for Father's Day. The Galaxy S25 Ultra Is a Killer Smartphone for Performance and Productivity Why should you get the Galaxy S25 Ultra over a Pixel, or a OnePlus, or a Vivo? It's not a perfect device, but there are still a lot of reasons I can list. But, before I get to those, the big answer is the S Pen. There's no other flagship smartphone in the market that comes with a built-in stylus, and that powers up the S25 Ultra for all productivity needs. Image: Samsung However, if the S Pen isn't enough to sway you, how about the rest of the spec sheet? 6.9-inch LTPO AMOLED display with 120Hz refresh, 2,600-nit peak brightness, and 1440p resolution Anti-reflective Gorilla Glass Armor 2 Snapdragon 8 Elite for Galaxy, clocked at up to 4.47GHz 200MP primary camera 50MP 5x telephoto, 10MP 3x telephoto, and an upgraded 50MP ultrawide Galaxy AI features and seven years of major Android updates Through Tecno, Gionee, Vivo, Google, and now Samsung, Ayomide has always been an Android enthusiast. His current partner in crime is a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. You can find him playing Candy Crush or Call of Duty: Mobile, watching movies, and he is a big fan of trivia and quizzes. Previous Post
html:
Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more.

I give Samsung a hard time for its reluctance to adopt trends that would only benefit the customers (silicon-carbon batteries, faster charging, updated cameras on non-Ultra models). However, if I don't compare and focus solely on each Samsung phone, it is hard to say that they aren't excellent. In fact, the S series is consistently good every year.

This year, we have the Galaxy S25 series, which doesn't bring that many changes to the spec sheet, but focuses mostly on optimizing the Galaxy AI experience that was introduced last year. The software is great, especially with One UI 7; the hardware is amazing, as usual; and that high price is at its lowest ever, in time for a Father's Day gift.

The Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra Is Available at $300 off on Amazon Right Now

I don't know if the Galaxy S25 Ultra is unarguably the flagship of the year, but to say that it isn't even in the running would be dishonest. The device brings the usual excellent Samsung formula, with a magnificent display, an overclocked Snapdragon 8 Elite, a great camera setup, and good software. For anyone who wants a flagship smartphone without doing too much research, you can never go wrong with the S25 Ultra.

Of course, being the most capable on paper than any of Samsung's other smartphones, it is no surprise that this one costs a lot of money. In fact, the S25 Ultra retails at $1,299, making it the second-most expensive device in the South Korean OEM's worldwide lineup, second only to the Galaxy Z Fold 6.

The good thing is, you can ignore that usually heavy pricing, at least for a limited amount of time. The Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is currently enjoying a hefty discount on Amazon US, knocking off $300, equivalent to 23% of its price, to bring it down to $999. The 512GB model also has a $300 discount at the moment.

Just so you know, the S25 Ultra has never been in the three-digit price range on Amazon, so this is a record price, and it is definitely worth getting for yourself or as a gift for Father's Day.

The Galaxy S25 Ultra Is a Killer Smartphone for Performance and Productivity

Why should you get the Galaxy S25 Ultra over a Pixel, or a OnePlus, or a Vivo? It's not a perfect device, but there are still a lot of reasons I can list. But, before I get to those, the big answer is the S Pen. There's no other flagship smartphone in the market that comes with a built-in stylus, and that powers up the S25 Ultra for all productivity needs.

However, if the S Pen isn't enough to sway you, how about the rest of the spec sheet?

  • 6.9-inch LTPO AMOLED display with 120Hz refresh, 2,600-nit peak brightness, and 1440p resolution
  • Anti-reflective Gorilla Glass Armor 2
  • Snapdragon 8 Elite for Galaxy, clocked at up to 4.47GHz
  • 200MP primary camera
  • 50MP 5x telephoto, 10MP 3x telephoto, and an upgraded 50MP ultrawide
  • Galaxy AI features and seven years of major Android updates

Through Tecno, Gionee, Vivo, Google, and now Samsung, Ayomide has always been an Android enthusiast. His current partner in crime is a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. You can find him playing Candy Crush or Call of Duty: Mobile, watching movies, and he is a big fan of trivia and quizzes.
